gurmukhi: BXo eyk pu`qRM qhwN jwnkI qY ]mno rwm kIno duqI rwm qy lY ]
transliteration: Bhayo Ek Pouttran Tahaan Jaanakitai|| Mano Raam Keeno Doutiraam Te Lai||
translation: Sita bore a son there who was just a replica of Ram;

gurmukhi: vhY cwr ichnM vhY au`gR qyjM ]mno A`p AMsM duqI kwiF ByjM ]725]
transliteration: Vahai Chaar Chihanan Vahai Ouggra Tejan|| Mano App Ansan Doutikaadh(i) Bhejan||725||
translation: He had the same colour, mask and splendour and it seemed that Ram had taken out his part and given to him.725.

gurmukhi: dIXo eyk pwlM su bwlM irKIsM ]lsY cMdR rUpM ikDo dXos eIsM ]
transliteration: Deeyo Ek Paalan Su Baalan Rikheesan|| Lasai Channdra Roopan Kidho Dyos Eesan||
translation: The great sage brought up that boy who was moonlike and lookede like the sun during the day.

gurmukhi: gXo eyk idvsM irKI sMiDXwnM ]lXo bwl sMgM geI sIA nwnM ]726]
transliteration: Gado Ek Divsan Rikhisandhiyaanan|| Layo Baal Sanadg Gadseeaa Naanan||726||
translation: One day the sage went for Sandhya-worship and Sita taking the boy with her went to take a bath.726.

gurmukhi: rhI jwq sIqw mhwN mon jwgy ]ibnwN bwl pwlM lKXo soku pwgy ]
transliteration: Rahijaat Seetaa Mahaan Mon Jaage|| Binaan Baal Paalan Lakhyo Sok(u) Paage||
translation: When the sage came out of his contemplation after the departure of Sita, he became anxious on not seeing the boy;

gurmukhi: kusw hwQ lY kY rcXo eyk bwlM ]iqsI rUp rMgM AnUpM auqwlM ]727]
transliteration: Kousaa Haath Lai Kai Rachyo Ek Baalan|| Tisiroop Ranadg Anoopan Outaalan||727||
translation: He created another boy quickly of the same colour and form like the first boy out of the Kusha grass held by him in his hand.727.

gurmukhi: iPrI nwie sIqw khw Awn dyKXo ]auhI rUp bwlM supwlM bsyKXo ]
transliteration: Phirinaae Seetaa Kahaa Aan Dekhyo|| Uhiroop Baalan Soupaalan Basekhyo||
translation: When Sita came back, she saw another boy of the same form seated there; Sita said :

gurmukhi: kiRpw mon rwjM GnI jwn kIno ]duqI pu`qR qw qy kiRpw jwn dIno ]728]
transliteration: Kridaa Mon Raajan Ghanijaan Keeno|| Doutipouttra Taa Te Kridaa Jaan Deeno||728||
translation: “O great sage, you had been highly graceful towards me and given me she gift of two sons gracefully.”728.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky rwmvqwr duie puqR auqpMny DXwie DXwie smwpqM ]21]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Raamavtaar Due Poutraoutpanne Dhyaae Samaaptan||21||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘The Birth of two Sons’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.21.

gurmukhi: auqY bwl pwlY ieqY AauD rwjM ]buly ib`p jgXM qjXo eyk bwjM ]
transliteration: Outai Baal Paalai Itai Audh Raajan|| Bule Bipp Jagyan Tajyo Ek Baajan||
translation: On that side the boys were brought up and on this side Ram, the king of Avadh called the Brahmins and performed a Yajna;

gurmukhi: irpM nws hMqw dXo sMg qwkY ]bfI Pauj lIny clXo sMg vwky ]729]
transliteration: Ripan Naas Hantaa Dayo San Taakai|| Badi Phauj Leene Chadyo San Vaake||729||
translation: And for this purpose he let off a horse, Shatrughan went with that horse with a huge army.729.

gurmukhi: iPrXo dys dysM nryswx bwjM ]iknI nwih bwDXo imly Awn rwjM ]
transliteration: Phiryo Des Desan Daresaan Baajan|| Kininaah(i) Baadhyo Mile Aan Raajan||
translation: That horse reached in the territories of various kings, but none of them tied it;

gurmukhi: mhwN augR DinXwN bfI Pauj lY kY ]pry Awn pwXM bfI Byt dY kY ]730]
transliteration: Mahaan Ougra Dhaniyaan Badiphauj Lai Kai|| Dare Aan Paayan Badibhet Dai Kai||730||
translation: The great kings alongwith their great forces fell at the feet of Shatrughan with presence.730.
